column4: N.Y. brokers lose SEC insider trading trial over IBM deal tip
column5: NEW YORK A federal jury on Monday found two former New York stockbrokers liable for trading on confidential tips about an IBM Corp acquisition  despite a major appeals court ruling that made insider trading cases harder to pursue.

column4: Buffett says owning IBM shares could prove a mistake: CNBC
column5: NEW YORK Warren Buffett  chairman and chief executive of Berkshire Hathaway Inc   told CNBC on Monday the firm's ownership of IBM  shares could prove a mistake and that he was buying more U.S. stocks overall since the end of last year.

column4: Citigroup sells stake in Chinese lender Guangfa for $3 billion
column5: HONG KONG Citigroup Inc  will sell its minority stake in Chinese regional lender China Guangfa Bank (CGB) for about 19.7 billion yuan ($3 billion) to China Life Insurance Company Ltd   the insurer said on Monday.

column4: IBM to purchase cyber security firm Resilient Systems
column5: IBM Security plans to acquire private cyber security firm Resilient Systems  the computing giant said Monday  as part of a move to expand its role in the incident response market.

column4: Intrepid Potash shares crash after auditor flags risks
column5: Intrepid Potash Inc  said on Monday its auditor has expressed doubts about its ability to stay in business  sending its shares plunging by more than half.

column4: Trader's ouster at JP Morgan affirms commitment to compliance
column5: NEW YORK  Feb 29 (IFR) - JP Morgan has swiftly severed ties with a top bond trader who circumvented its compliance procedures earlier this year as the bank moves to reinforce its commitment to risk management.

column4: Toshiba to sell entire medical unit  deal may see aggressive bids -sources
column5: TOKYO  Feb 29 Struggling Toshiba Corp  plans to sell its entire medical equipment unit rather than just a controlling stake  people familiar with matter said  adding that aggressive bidding could value the business at much more than initial estimates of $3.5 billion.

column5: Chinese investor GO Scale Capital  whose bid for Philips's  lighting-components business was blocked by the U.S. government in January  is bidding for the company's other lighting division  Bloomberg reported  citing people familiar with the matter.

column4: Lockheed unit to help design quieter supersonic passenger jet-NASA
column5: Feb 29 NASA on Monday announced a contract award to Lockheed Martin Corp's unit for the preliminary design of a "low boom" flight demonstration aircraft.

column4: Lockheed Martin to pay $5 million in settlement over Kentucky plant: U.S.
column5: WASHINGTON Lockheed Martin Corp has agreed to pay $5 million to settle alleged violations over the operating of the Paducah Gaseous Diffusion Plant in Paducah  Kentucky  the U.S. Department of Justice said on Monday.

column4: Lumber Liquidators' sales fall more than feared  shares drop
column5: Lumber Liquidators Holdings Inc  reported a bigger-than-expected drop in sales for the third straight quarter as it struggled with falling demand due to fears that some of its hardwood flooring laminates could cause cancer.

column4: Lumber Liquidators quarterly sales fall nearly 14 pct
column5: Feb 29 Lumber Liquidators Holdings Inc  reported a decrease in quarterly sales as the hardwood flooring retailer battles falling demand on reports that some of its laminates contained excessive levels of cancer-causing formaldehyde.

column4: Bond insurer MBIA's quarterly profit surges
column5: Feb 29 Bond insurer MBIA Inc reported a four-fold jump in quarterly profit  helped by an increase in net investment income and a fall in expenses.

column4: Puerto Rico exposure eyed as bond insurer MBIA set to post results
column5: NEW YORK MBIA Inc   a bond insurer heavily exposed to fiscally troubled Puerto Rico  will report fourth-quarter earnings after the bell on Monday when investors will look for commentary on potential losses from exposure to the island's debt.

column4: Debt swaps become a tough sell for cash-strapped US energy firms
column5: NEW YORK  Feb 29 Highly-leveraged U.S. energy companies are struggling to carry out debt swaps as part of their survival strategy because plummeting oil and gas prices make investors either avoid such deals or demand tougher terms.

column4: TRLPC: Bowie Resource's loan for Peabody Energy assets temporarily shelved
column5: NEW YORK  Feb 29 Bowie Resource's $650 million loan to finance the purchase of coal mine assets from Peabody Energy Corp has been "temporarily shelved " according to a source close to the deal.

column4: China Petrobras loan cuts need for government bailout -Itau BBA
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  Feb 29 A credit line of up to $10 billion from China's state development bank to Petrobras cuts the risk that Brazil's  state-run oil company would need government assistance to pay for debt and investment in 2016  Banco Itau BBA said on Monday.

column4: Petrobras bonds end higher on China loan
column5: NEW YORK  Feb 29 (IFR) - Bonds issued by Brazil's Petrobras ended the day one to two points higher on Monday as the beleaguered oil company eased refinancing pressure by clinching a US$10bn loan from China.

column5: SYDNEY  Feb 29 Australian shares were little changed on Monday  ending less than one point firmer  with major miners BHP Billiton and Rio Tinto showing only slight movement.

column5: GENEVA Toyota Motor Corp  and Germany's BMW  are still keen to develop a common sportscar architecture but have yet to decide on a timeline for the project  a senior executive at the Japanese carmaker said on Monday.

column4: REFILE-UPDATE 3-Valeant shares slide on news of probe by U.S. SEC
column5: Feb 29 Shares in Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc fell as much as 21 percent on Monday after the embattled drugmaker revealed that it was under investigation by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.

column4: CANADA STOCKS-TSX rises as energy gains offset slump in Valeant
column5: TORONTO  Feb 29 Canada's main stock index ended higher on Monday  with gains for energy companies due to rise in oil offsetting a plunge in shares of Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc after the drug company said it was being probed by a U.S. securities regulator.

column4: Valeant shares drop as CEO returns  cancels earnings report
column5: Feb 29 Shares in embattled drugmaker Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  fell 9 percent on Monday a day after the company said its chief executive officer had returned from medical leave  canceled the release of fourth-quarter earnings  and withdrew 2016 financial guidance.

column4: Duty revision on iron ore  aluminium to boost Vedanta
column5: NEW DELHI India said on Monday it would raise the import duty on aluminium but cut the export tax on low grade iron ore  a move that would benefit Vedanta Ltd  the most as it is a big producer of both commodities.

column4: Gender bias lawsuit against Wal-Mart can proceed after high court denies review
column5: The Supreme Court on Monday rejected Wal-Mart's bid to overturn a federal appeals court decision allowing female workers to sue the retail giant for paying women less and giving them fewer promotions than men.
